verses.verse: In that day<WH3117> shall this song<WH7892> be sung<WH7891> in the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>; We have a strong<WH5797> city<WH5892>; salvation<WH3444> will God appoint<WH7896> for walls<WH2346> and bulwarks<WH2426>.
Open<WH6605> ye the gates<WH8179>, that the righteous<WH6662> nation<WH1471> which keepeth<WH8104> the truth<WH529> may enter in<WH935>. truth: Heb. truths

Thou wilt keep<WH5341> him in perfect<WH7965> peace<WH7965>, whose mind<WH3336> is stayed<WH5564> on thee: because he trusteth<WH982> in thee. perfect: Heb. peace, peace mind: or, thought, or, imagination
Trust<WH982> ye in the LORD<WH3068> for ever<WH5703>: for in the LORD<WH3050> JEHOVAH<WH3068> is everlasting<WH5769> strength<WH6697>: everlasting: Heb. the rock of ages

For he bringeth down<WH7817> them that dwell<WH3427> on high<WH4791>; the lofty<WH7682> city<WH7151>, he layeth it low<WH8213>; he layeth it low<WH8213>, even to the ground<WH776>; he bringeth<WH5060> it even to the dust<WH6083>.
The foot<WH7272> shall tread it down<WH7429>, even the feet<WH7272> of the poor<WH6041>, and the steps<WH6471> of the needy<WH1800>.
The way<WH734> of the just<WH6662> is uprightness<WH4339>: thou, most upright<WH3477>, dost weigh<WH6424> the path<WH4570> of the just<WH6662>.

Yea, in the way<WH734> of thy judgments<WH4941>, O LORD<WH3068>, have we waited<WH6960> for thee; the desire<WH8378> of our soul<WH5315> is to thy name<WH8034>, and to the remembrance<WH2143> of thee.

With my soul<WH5315> have I desired<WH183> thee in the night<WH3915>; yea, with my spirit<WH7307> within<WH7130> me will I seek thee early<WH7836>: for when thy judgments<WH4941> are in the earth<WH776>, the inhabitants<WH3427> of the world<WH8398> will learn<WH3925> righteousness<WH6664>.

Let favour be shewed<WH2603> to the wicked<WH7563>, yet will he not<WH1077> learn<WH3925> righteousness<WH6664>: in the land<WH776> of uprightness<WH5229> will he deal unjustly<WH5765>, and will not<WH1077> behold<WH7200> the majesty<WH1348> of the LORD<WH3068>.

LORD<WH3068>, when thy hand<WH3027> is lifted up<WH7311>, they will not see<WH2372>: but they shall see<WH2372>, and be ashamed<WH954> for their envy<WH7068> at the people<WH5971>; yea, the fire<WH784> of thine enemies<WH6862> shall devour<WH398> them. at: or, toward thy people
LORD<WH3068>, thou wilt ordain<WH8239> peace<WH7965> for us: for thou also hast wrought<WH6466> all our works<WH4639> in us. in us: or, for us
O LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430>, other lords<WH113> beside<WH2108> thee have had dominion<WH1166> over us: but by thee only will we make mention<WH2142> of thy name<WH8034>.

They are dead<WH4191>, they shall not live<WH2421>; they are deceased<WH7496>, they shall not rise<WH6965>: therefore hast thou visited<WH6485> and destroyed<WH8045> them, and made all their memory<WH2143> to perish<WH6>.

Thou hast increased<WH3254> the nation<WH1471>, O LORD<WH3068>, thou hast increased<WH3254> the nation<WH1471>: thou art glorified<WH3513>: thou hadst removed it far<WH7368> unto all the ends<WH7099> of the earth<WH776>.
LORD<WH3068>, in trouble<WH6862> have they visited<WH6485> thee, they poured out<WH6694> a prayer<WH3908> when thy chastening<WH4148> was upon them. prayer: Heb. secret speech

Like<WH3644> as a woman with child<WH2030>, that draweth near<WH7126> the time of her delivery<WH3205>, is in pain<WH2342>, and crieth out<WH2199> in her pangs<WH2256>; so have we been in thy sight<WH6440>, O LORD<WH3068>.

We have been with child<WH2029>, we have been in pain<WH2342>, we have as it were<WH3644> brought forth<WH3205> wind<WH7307>; we have not wrought<WH6213> any deliverance<WH3444> in the earth<WH776>; neither<WH1077> have the inhabitants<WH3427> of the world<WH8398> fallen<WH5307>.

Thy dead<WH4191> men shall live<WH2421>, together with my dead body<WH5038> shall they arise<WH6965>. Awake<WH6974> and sing<WH7442>, ye that dwell<WH7931> in dust<WH6083>: for thy dew<WH2919> is as the dew<WH2919> of herbs<WH219>, and the earth<WH776> shall cast out<WH5307> the dead<WH7496>.

Come<WH3212>, my people<WH5971>, enter<WH935> thou into thy chambers<WH2315>, and shut<WH5462> thy doors<WH1817> about thee: hide<WH2247> thyself as it were for a little<WH4592> moment<WH7281>, until the indignation<WH2195> be overpast<WH5674>.

For, behold, the LORD<WH3068> cometh out<WH3318> of his place<WH4725> to punish<WH6485> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the earth<WH776> for their iniquity<WH5771>: the earth<WH776> also shall disclose<WH1540> her blood<WH1818>, and shall no more cover<WH3680> her slain<WH2026>. blood: Heb. bloods
